# Review of Literature

Table 1

*Comparison of the Teacher Induction and Social Media Literatures*

```{r packages, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
```

```{r table-1, tidy=TRUE, include=TRUE, echo=FALSE}

table1 <- data.frame(
  col1 = c(
    "Supports for Professional Learning",
    "Reasons for Supports",
    "Interpersonal Connections"
  ),
  col2 = c(
    "Primarily formal induction programs (e.g., mentoring, seminars, collaborative work times), some school-external networks",
    "Induction challenges (e.g., everything is new, still learning, professional-identity formation)",
    "Primarily local relationships (e.g., mentors, peers, administrators), some school-external networks (e.g., virtual learning communities, virtual workshops)"
  ),
  col3 = c(
    "Primarily informal learning opportunities (e.g., resources, skills, curricular materials, encouragement)",
    "General difficulty of teaching (e.g., emotionally tiring, needing to look for very specific ideas, pressures to appear competent to local colleagues, professional isolation)",
    "Primarily global networks (e.g., Twitter hashtags, subreddits, Pinterest accounts), some local connections (e.g., course assignments for preservice teachers)"
  )
)

knitr::kable(table1,
             col.names=c("PLN Component", 
                         "Teacher Induction literature", 
                         "Social Media literature"
                         ),
             booktabs = TRUE) %>%
  kable_styling(full_width=TRUE) %>%
  column_spec(1, bold=TRUE, border_right=FALSE)
```
